attributes.comment:
I was amazed and disappointed to hear about these proposed increases -
adotpiton is already cost prohibited. My husband and I are currently in the
process of adoption a child from China.

Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a couple to adopt prior to the recent
slow down:

When Chinese adoption took less then 18 months - those days are long gone:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%! The USCIS will
make 140% from adopting parents, with no real increase in services.

And that's not even taking into consideration the fact that applying for our
children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to
$460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, we don't even
get the certificates for a year after filing!

It is all very difficult to understand - when you cannot have a family by natural
means and your only hope for raising a child is through adoption it does not feel
particularly good when you feel like your own government wants to add to the
burden. Please consider all of use little people and the struggles we face when
you make these substantial increases.

Thank you
Heather

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Heather Kane
